sorular.soru: Is a flag mandatory for tow ropes?

feedback.metin: Attaching a flag to the tow rope is not mandatory. However, most tow ropes are equipped with a small red flag in the middle to make the rope more visible. There must be no more than 5 metres of space between the rear of the towing vehicle and the front of the towed vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly here?

feedback.metin: You may use a bicycle lane with a broken line to get into the right lane, provided you do not obstruct other vehicles such as cyclists or snorfietsers. If you were to get into the cycle lane here, you are obstructing the cyclist. This is because you have to wait for the pedestrian. So in this case you are not allowed to pre-sort on the cycle lane.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to unload goods here?

feedback.metin: Stopping at a bus stop is prohibited. You are only allowed to pick up or drop off passengers quickly. Loading and unloading is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles may not enter here?

feedback.metin: The C-11 sign indicates that the road is only closed to motorcycle drivers. A road where the C-11 sign is placed, for example, may be used by drivers of lorries, passenger cars, and mopeds.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: Crossing a solid edge line is allowed, so you can park next to the road unless otherwise prohibited by signage. Parking on the hard shoulder of a motorway or the refuge of an autoweg is forbidden, as these may only be used in emergencies. However, this is not a motorway or an autoweg. The presence of an information sign is an important indication that you are allowed to park here. Waiting and looking at a map both qualify as parking, as does using a telephone.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly to turn left?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a partial one-way street. This road classification does not apply to bicycles, mopeds, snorfietsen, and speed pedelecs. You must therefore position yourself to the right of the centre axis of the road rather than to the left.

sorular.soru: Who should go first?
cevaplar: They give way to each other.

feedback.metin: When weaving, traffic merging in and out may enter the same lane simultaneously. As you must give way to other traffic when merging, there is no law regarding who can do this first. However, national recommendations say that the driver merging out should go first, as they are often driving faster. This is also less of an inconvenience to drivers on the main carriageway.

sorular.soru: Can you make changes to your driving licence yourself?

feedback.metin: Making any changes yourself to your driving licence will render it invalid. It is prohibited to make any changes like changing your name, date of birth or photograph.

sorular.soru: Your rear lights are partly covered in snow. Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: Compulsory lighting should not be covered with snow. You may not drive.

sorular.soru: What is dangerous about driving like this?
cevaplar: The child may be thrown out of the seat in the event of a collision.
The child may loosen the seat belt themselves.
The airbag may hit the child in the event of a collision.
sorular.dogruCevap: The child may be thrown out of the seat in the event of a collision.

feedback.metin: The child’s seat belt is too loose, partly due to the winter coat. Always place children in the vehicle without (thick) winter coats on, as these prevent the seat belt from doing its job. In this case, the child could be thrown from the seat in the event of a head-on collision, significantly increasing the risk of fatal injury.

sorular.soru: How is the right of way regulated here?
cevaplar: Pedestrians approaching from the right have right of way.
Road users approaching from the right have right of way.
Drivers approaching from the right have right of way.
sorular.dogruCevap: Drivers approaching from the right have right of way.

feedback.metin: This raised intersection is a normal equivalent intersection. Here, the general rule of priority is that drivers approaching from the right have right of way.

sorular.soru: Can you park here on the 5th of May?

feedback.metin: There is a parking ban from the 1st to the 15th of each month on the side of the road where the sign is placed.

sorular.soru: What is a speed pedelec?
cevaplar: An electric bicycle that must follow the rules applicable to snorfietsen.
An electric bicycle that must follow the rules applicable to bicycles.
An electric bicycle that must follow the rules applicable to mopeds.
sorular.dogruCevap: An electric bicycle that must follow the rules applicable to mopeds.

feedback.metin: Speed pedelecs are electric bicycles subject to the rules applicable to mopeds. Unlike electric bicycles with pedal assistance, where the electric motor stops running at 25 km/h, the motor on a speed pedelec continues to run above this speed. Speed pedelecs may be ridden at a maximum of 45 km/h and must be equipped with a yellow number plate. Speed pedelec riders must wear a helmet.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: The green line indicates that you are driving on an autoweg, where the speed limit is 100 km/h.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop at a safe place and refill engine oil immediately.
Stop in a safe place and check the oil level.
Stop immediately and check the oil level.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and check the oil level.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, it means that there is something wrong with the oil level. Usually, it is too low. Because the light is not red, you do not have to stop immediately, but you can drive to a safe place such as a car park or petrol station. Always check the oil first before refilling it, if necessary. Excessive oil levels can also cause problems.

sorular.soru: Does a standard glass of beer contain as much alcohol as a standard glass of wine?

feedback.metin: Different glasses are used for different types of alcohol. Gin, for example, is served in a small glass, while beer is served in a larger glass. The sizes of standard glasses are chosen in such a way that each glass of alcohol beverage contains approximately the same amount of pure alcohol. So, whether you drink one standard glass of beer, wine, or gin, you will consume the same amount of pure alcohol.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here at 10:00 AM?

feedback.metin: The matrix signs indicate the end of all bans indicated by previous matrix signs. The A-1 sign indicates a speed limit of 100 km/h from 6:00 AM until 7:00 PM.

sorular.soru: You want to turn right. Can you change to the right lane?

feedback.metin: When the block marking becomes a solid line, you can no longer change lanes. You must stay in your lane.

sorular.soru: Does pulling a caravan use additional energy?
cevaplar: Only if the caravan is unbraked.

feedback.metin: When towing a caravan or trailer with a car, more energy is used because the vehicle has to move not only itself but also the vehicle caravan or trailer. Whether the caravan is braked or not makes no difference.

sorular.soru: Should you expect moped riders and snorfiets riders on the road after this sign?
cevaplar: No, this road is closed to moped riders and snorfiets riders.
Yes, anyone can use this road.
Yes, but no cyclists or pedestrians.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, anyone can use this road.

feedback.metin: On roads with a speed limit of 60 km/h, you can expect cyclists, moped riders, speed pedelec riders, snorfiets riders, agricultural traffic, and pedestrians, as well as motor vehicles on the road. These roads are outside built-up areas and have a lower speed limit due to nearby houses and plots of land.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a malfunctioning horn?

feedback.metin: A car must have a functioning horn with a fixed pitch.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you have a breakdown while the rush-hour lane is open and you cannot reach the lay-by?
cevaplar: Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, call 112, and warn oncoming traffic.
Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, stand behind the crash barrier, and call 112.
Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, call 112, and wait in the vehicle for the emergency services.
sorular.dogruCevap: Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, stand behind the crash barrier, and call 112.

feedback.metin: Hard shoulders are used as rush-hour lanes, so if you break down while the rush hour lane is open, you cannot use the hard shoulder. Besides the rush-hour lane, there is a breakdown layby every 100 to 500 metres. If possible, try to reach this layby in the event of a breakdown. If you cannot reach the layby, park your vehicle as far to the right of the road as possible, on the lane or in the verge. Switch on your hazard lights and stand behind the crash barrier or on the verge, then call 112 for help. Do not attempt to warn oncoming traffic as this may be dangerous.

sorular.soru: Is it mandatory to turn off dipped headlights when exiting a tunnel?

feedback.metin: Dipped headlights should be used when visibility is poor and/or at night, and in tunnels during the day. You must switch on dipped headlights before entering a tunnel. You are not required to turn these off when exiting the tunnel, as this lighting is also allowed during the day.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: Pedestrians with a walker fall under the category 'limited mobility'. You must give way and allow them to cross.

sorular.soru: Are you giving the bus enough space?

feedback.metin: Drivers of long vehicles have a large turning radius and therefore need a lot of space to get through a bend. You drove too far here and it is now difficult or impossible for the bus to make the turn.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the brommobiel here?
cevaplar: Yes. The brommobiel falls under slow-moving traffic - just like the tractor.
Yes. Because a brommobiel is not a passenger car.

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to overtake the brommobiel here. You must treat a brommobiel as if it were a motor vehicle and the sign indicates that motor vehicles are not allowed to overtake each other. The supplementary plate only indicates that you are allowed to overtake tractors, which fall under a different category than the brommobiel.

sorular.soru: You are almost out of petrol and have just passed the petrol station. Are you allowed to reverse?

feedback.metin: Reversing is always prohibited on autowegen and motorways. If you run out of petrol and cannot get to the next petrol station, leave the motorway via the next available exit. If you cannot get to the exit, park your vehicle safely and seek help.

sorular.soru: Which marking should be on the rear of a long heavy lorry combination (LZV)?

feedback.metin: The rear of a long heavy lorry combination (LZV) must display sign B at the rear. Sign A is a sign for lorries and is no longer required in The Netherlands. It indicates that you are encountering a lorry. Sign C is used to mark protruding load on a motor vehicle or its trailer.

sorular.soru: Are these horse riders using the road properly?

feedback.metin: Horse riders are required to use the bridle path. If this is not available, they may use the verge or the carriageway. Horse riders are also not allowed to ride next to each other on the carriageway. Only cyclists are allowed to ride side by side.

sorular.soru: You want to follow the road to the left. Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: At equivalent intersections, drivers must give way to drivers coming from the right for them. The cyclist is a driver and is coming from the right relative to you. The cyclist therefore has priority. It makes no difference here whether the road to the right is a cycle path or a carriageway for motor vehicles.

sorular.soru: What is not allowed in a one-way street?

feedback.metin: On a one-way street, drivers are only allowed to go in one direction. That is why they are not allowed to turn around or reverse. Stopping or parking is not prohibited by definition.

sorular.soru: How do you react best in this situation?

feedback.metin: When a driver performs a dangerous overtaking manoeuvre, try to avoid an accident. As the overtaking driver's speed is higher than your speed, you can make way for that driver by braking. And if an accident does occur, a lower speed is always safer. Never steer into the verge, as this will put yourself in danger.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: The end of a 70 km/h speed limit is indicated here. The number on the sign indicates which speed limit has ended. The priority sign after the intersection means that this road is outside a built-up area, so the speed limit here is 80 km/h.

sorular.soru: What should you take into account when it is only 3 degrees Celsius outside?
cevaplar: That you have to adjust the tyre pressure.

feedback.metin: When the temperature outside drops below 4 degrees Celsius, the ground becomes colder and slipperiness may occur. This is also known as ground frost. Despite the fact the thermometer does not indicate frost yet, you must take this into account when driving. Winter tyres are not mandatory in the Netherlands, and the tyre pressure does not have to be adjusted for winter weather. However, you should check this regularly.

sorular.soru: Can motorcyclists overtake traffic jams like this?
cevaplar: Yes, motorcyclists are allowed to overtake traffic jams like this slowly.
No, motorcyclists are not allowed to overtake traffic jams like this.
No, this is only allowed when there are less than two lanes.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, motorcyclists are not allowed to overtake traffic jams like this.

feedback.metin: A redressing strip is a paved strip on the left-hand side of the outer lane that aims to catch vehicles that have drifted off course and bring them back on course. On motorways, the crash barrier is located directly next to the redressing strip. Hard shoulders, displacement surfaces, and redressing strips may not be used or crossed.
